alert.note: Alert for Finney; Grant; Hamilton; Haskell; Kearny; Morton; Seward; Stanton; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 11 at 3:47PM CDT until April 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON CDT /11 AM MDT/ TO 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Hamilton, Kearny, Finney, Stanton, Grant, Haskell, Morton, Stevens and Seward Counties. * WHEN...From noon CDT /11 AM MDT/ to 8 PM CDT /7 PM MDT/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread significant blowing dust can be expected given the continued extreme to exceptional drought conditions. Widespread visibility of one half to one mile can be expected. Local visibility well below one quarter of a mile will be possible, leading to dangerous travel.
info.instruction: The Kansas Department of Health and Environment recommends that you take preventative measures during this blowing dust event...such as staying indoors or wearing protective breathing masks if outside. High dust concentrations can cause respiratory problems...decrease lung activity...aggravate asthma...and lead to potential heart-related problems...especially with children...elderly...or those with pre-existing respiratory conditions. People should avoid being outside around large trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the high wind event, and avoid windows. Use extreme caution if you must drive, especially in areas of significant blowing dust.

area.areaDesc: Finney; Grant; Hamilton; Haskell; Kearny; Morton; Seward; Stanton; Stevens
